              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 9.1pt"></font>34,537</font></td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
              <td valign="bottom" width="76%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Lease
      inducements</font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 13.5pt"></font>30,561</font></td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
              <td valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 9.1pt"></font>27,965</font></td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
              <td valign="bottom" width="76%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Allowance</font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 11.25pt"></font>(1,518</font></td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">)</font></td>
              <td valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 6.85pt"></font>(3,027</font></td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">)</font></td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
              <td valign="bottom" width="76%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Accounts
      receivable &#8211; net</font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">$</font></td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">75,037</font></td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
              <td valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">$</font></td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">64,992</font></td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
            </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In 2008,
we recorded a $5.7 million lease inducements associated with the master lease
agreement with affiliates of Formation Capital (&#8220;Formation&#8221;), the new
operator/tenant of 13 facilities previously operated by Haven.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">We
continuously evaluate the payment history and financial strength of our
operators and have historically established allowance reserves for straight-line
rent adjustments for operators that do not meet our requirements.&#160;&#160;We
consider factors such as payment history, the operator&#8217;s financial condition as
well as current and future anticipated operating trends when evaluating whether
to establish allowance reserves.&#160;&#160;During the three months ended June
30, 2008, we recorded a $4.3 million provision for uncollectible accounts
receivable associated with Haven receivables.&#160;&#160;The $4.3 million charge
consisted of $3.3 million to write-off straight-line receivables and $1.0
million to establish an allowance for pre-petition contractual receivables
associated with Haven.&#160;&#160;In 2008, we wrote-off some receivables that
were fully reserved.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Accounts receivable from owned and
operated assets consist of amounts due from Medicare and Medicaid programs,
other government programs, managed care health plans, commercial insurance
companies and individual patients. Amounts recorded include estimated provisions
for loss related to uncollectible accounts and disputed items.&#160;&#160;For
additional information, see Note 4 &#8211; Owned and Operated Assets.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Investments
in Debt and Equity Securities</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Marketable securities classified as
available-for-sale are stated at fair value with unrealized gains and losses
recorded in accumulated other comprehensive income.&#160;&#160;Realized gains
and losses and declines in value judged to be other-than-temporary on securities
held as available-for-sale are included in other income. The cost of securities
sold is based on the specific identification method. If events or circumstances
indicate that the fair value of an investment has declined below its carrying
value and we consider the decline to be &#8220;other than temporary,&#8221; the investment
is written down to fair value and an impairment loss is recognized.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Comprehensive
Income</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>SFAS 130, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Reporting Comprehensive
Income</font>, establishes guidelines for the reporting and display of
comprehensive income and its components in financial
statements.&#160;&#160;Comprehensive income includes net income and all other
non-owner changes in stockholders&#8217; equity during a period including unrealized
gains and losses on equity securities classified as available-for-sale and
unrealized fair value adjustments on certain derivative
instruments.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          </div>
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">-F11-</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">OMEGA
HEALTHCARE INVESTORS, INC.</font></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED
FINANCIAL STATEMENTS - Continued</font> </font></div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Deferred
Financing Costs</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>External costs incurred from placement
of our debt are capitalized and amortized on a straight-line basis over the
terms of the related borrowings which approximate the effective interest method.
Amortization of financing costs totaling $2.0 million, $2.0 million and $2.0
million in 2008, 2007 and 2006, respectively, is classified as &#8220;interest -
amortization of deferred financing costs&#8221; in our&#160;consolidated statements of
income.&#160;&#160;When financings are terminated, unamortized amounts paid, as
well as charges incurred for the termination, are expensed at the time the
termination is made.&#160;&#160;Gains and losses from the extinguishment of debt
are presented as interest expense within income from continuing operations in
the accompanying consolidated financial statements.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Revenue
Recognition</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>We have various different investments
that generate revenue, including leased and mortgaged properties, as well as
other investments, including working capital loans.&#160;&#160;We recognize
rental income and mortgage interest income and other investment income as earned
over the terms of the related master leases and notes,
respectively.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Substantially all of our leases contain
provisions for specified annual increases over the rents of the prior year and
are generally computed in one of three methods depending on specific provisions
of each lease as follows: (i) a specific annual increase over the prior year&#8217;s
rent, generally 2.5%; (ii) an increase based on the change in pre-determined
formulas from year to year (i.e., such as increases in the Consumer Price Index
(&#8220;CPI&#8221;)); or (iii) specific dollar increases over prior
years.&#160;&#160;Revenue under lease arrangements with specific determinable
increases is recognized over the term of the lease on a straight-line
basis.&#160;&#160;Securities and Exchange Commission (&#8220;SEC&#8221;) Staff Accounting
Bulletin No. 101, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Revenue
Recognition in Financial Statements,</font> does not provide for the recognition
of contingent revenue until all possible contingencies have been
eliminated.&#160;&#160;We consider the operating history of the lessee, the
payment history, the general condition of the industry and various other factors
when evaluating whether all possible contingencies have been
eliminated.&#160;&#160;We do not include contingent rents as income until the
contingencies have been resolved.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>In the case of rental revenue
recognized on a straight-line basis, we generally record reserves against earned
revenues from leases when collection becomes questionable or when negotiations
for restructurings of troubled operators result in significant uncertainty
regarding ultimate collection.&#160;&#160;The amount of the reserve is estimated
based on what management believes will likely be collected.&#160;&#160;We
continually evaluate the collectability of our straight-line rent
assets.&#160;&#160;If it appears that we will not collect future rent due under
our leases, we will record a provision for loss related to the straight-line
rent asset.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Recognizing rental income on a
straight-line basis may cause recognized revenue to exceed contractual amounts
due from our tenants.&#160;&#160;Such cumulative excess amounts are included in
accounts receivable and were $43.1 million and $33.9 million, net of allowances,
at December 31, 2008 and 2007, respectively.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Gains on
sales of real estate assets are recognized pursuant to the provisions of SFAS
No. 66, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Accounting for Sales
of Real Estate </font>(&#8220;SFAS No. 66&#8221;).&#160;&#160;The specific timing of the
recognition of the sale and the related gain is measured against the various
criteria in SFAS No. 66 related to the terms of the transactions and any
continuing involvement associated with the assets sold.&#160;&#160;To the extent
the sales criteria are not met, we defer gain recognition until the sales
criteria are met.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Nursing
home revenues of owned and operated assets consist of long-term care revenues,
rehabilitation therapy services revenues, temporary medical staffing services
revenues and other ancillary services revenues. The revenues are recognized as
services are provided.&#160;&#160;Revenues are recorded net of provisions for
discount arrangements with commercial payors and contractual allowances with
third-party payors, primarily Medicare and Medicaid.&#160;&#160;Revenues
realizable under third-party payor agreements are subject to change due to
examination and retroactive adjustment.&#160;&#160;Estimated third-party payor
settlements are recorded in the period the related services are rendered. The
methods of making such estimates are reviewed periodically, and differences
between the net amounts accrued and subsequent settlements or estimates of
expected settlements are reflected in the current period results of operations.
Laws and regulations governing the Medicare and Medicaid programs are extremely
complex and subject to interpretation.&#160;&#160;For additional information,
see Note 4 &#8211; Owned and Operated Assets.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center">&#160;</div>
          </div>
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">-F12-</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">OMEGA
HEALTHCARE INVESTORS, INC.</font></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED
FINANCIAL STATEMENTS - Continued</font> </font></div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Assets
Held for Sale and Discontinued Operations</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Pursuant to the provisions of SFAS No.
144, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Accounting for the
Impairment or Disposal of Long-Lived Assets </font>(&#8220;SFAS No. 144&#8221;), the
operating results of specified real estate assets that have been sold, or
otherwise qualify as held for disposition (as defined by SFAS No. 144), are
reflected as assets held for sale in our balance sheet.&#160;&#160;Assets that
qualify as held for sale may also be considered as a discontinued operation if,
(a) the operation and cash flows of the asset have been or will be eliminated
from future operations and (b) we will not have significant involvement with the
asset after its disposition. For assets that qualify as discontinued operations,
we have reclassified the operations of those assets to discontinued operations
in the consolidated statements of&#160;income for all periods presented and
assets held for sale in the consolidated balance sheet for all periods
presented.&#160;&#160;We had one assets held for sale as of December 31, 2008
with a net book value of $0.2 million.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>For additional information, see Note 19
&#8211; Discontinued Operations.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Derivative
Instruments</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>We follow SFAS No. 133, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Accounting for Derivative
Instruments and Hedging Activities</font>, as amended, (&#8220;FAS No.
133&#8221;).&#160;&#160;From time to time we may use derivatives financial instruments
to manage interest rates.&#160;&#160;These instruments include options,
forwards, interest rate swaps, caps or floors or a combination thereof depending
on the underlying exposure.&#160;&#160;We do not use derivatives for trading or
speculative purposes.&#160;&#160;On the date we enter into a derivative, the
derivative is designated as a hedge of the identified exposure.&#160;&#160;We
measure the effectiveness of its hedging relationships both at the hedge
inception and on an ongoing basis.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>FAS No.133 requires that all
derivatives are recognized on the balance sheet at fair
value.&#160;&#160;Derivatives that are not hedges are adjusted to fair value
through income.&#160;&#160;If the derivative is a hedge, depending on the nature
of the hedge, changes in the fair value of derivatives are either offset against
the change in fair value of the hedged assets, liabilities, or firm commitments
through earnings or recognized in other comprehensive income until the hedge
item is recognized in earnings. Gains and losses related to hedged transaction
are deferred and recognized as interest expense in the period or periods that
the underlying transaction occurs, expires or is otherwise terminated. The
ineffective portion of a derivative&#8217;s change in fair value will be immediately
recognized in earnings.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>At December 31, 2008 and 2007, we had
no derivative instruments.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Earnings
Per Share</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Basic earnings per common share (&#8220;EPS&#8221;)
is computed by dividing net income available to common stockholders by the
weighted-average number of shares of common stock outstanding during the
year.&#160;&#160;Diluted EPS reflects the potential dilution that could occur
from shares issuable through stock-based compensation, including stock options
and restricted stock.&#160;&#160;For additional information, see Note 18 &#8211;
Earnings Per Share.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Income
Taxes</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>We were organized to qualify for
taxation as a REIT under Section 856 through 860 of the Internal Revenue
Code.&#160;&#160;So long as we qualify as a REIT; we will not be subject to
Federal income taxes on the REIT taxable income that we distributed to
shareholders, subject to certain exceptions.&#160;&#160;In 2008, we paid
preferred and common dividend payments of $98.1 million which satisfies the 2008
REIT requirements relating to qualifying income.&#160;&#160;We are permitted to
own up to 100% of a taxable REIT subsidiary (&#8220;TRS&#8221;).&#160;&#160;Currently, we
have one TRS that is taxable as a corporation and that pays federal, state and
local income tax on its net income at the applicable corporate
rates.&#160;&#160;The loss carry-forward was fully reserved with a valuation
allowance due to uncertainties regarding realization.&#160;&#160;We record
interest and penalty charges associated with tax matters as income
tax.&#160;&#160;For additional information on income taxes, see Note 11 &#8211;
Taxes.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">-F13-</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">OMEGA
HEALTHCARE INVESTORS, INC.</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED
FINANCIAL STATEMENTS - Continued</font> </font></div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>On January 1, 2007, we adopted
Financial Accounting Standards Board (&#8220;FASB&#8221;) Interpretation No. 48 (&#8220;FIN 48&#8221;),
<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Accounting for Uncertainty in
Income Taxes,</font> <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">an
interpretation of FASB Statement No. 109</font>, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Accounting for Income
Taxes</font>.&#160;&#160;FIN 48 clarifies the accounting for uncertainty in
income taxes recognized in an enterprise&#8217;s financial statements in accordance
with FASB Statement No. 109, by defining a criterion that an individual tax
position must meet for any part of that position to be recognized in an
enterprise&#8217;s financial statements.&#160;&#160;The interpretation requires a
review of all tax positions accounted for in accordance with FASB Statement No.
109 and applies a more-likely-than-not recognition threshold.&#160;&#160;A tax
position that meets the more-likely-than-not recognition threshold is initially
and subsequently measured as the largest amount of tax benefit that is greater
than 50 percent likely of being realized upon ultimate settlement with the
taxing authority that has full knowledge of all relevant
information.&#160;&#160;We are subject to the provisions of FIN 48 beginning
January 1, 2007.&#160;&#160;We evaluated FIN 48 and determined that the adoption
of FIN 48 had no impact on our financial statements.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Stock-Based
Compensation</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Prior to January 1, 2006, we accounted
for stock based compensation using the intrinsic value method as defined by APB
Opinion No. 25, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Accounting for
Stock Issued to Employees </font>(&#8220;APB 25&#8221;).&#160;&#160;Under APB 25, we
generally recognized compensation expense only for restricted stock
grants.&#160;&#160;We have recognized the compensation expense associated with
the restricted stock ratably over the associated service period.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Effective January 1, 2006, we adopted
the provisions of SFAS No. 123 (revised 2004), <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Share-Based Payment</font> (&#8220;SFAS
No. 123(R)&#8221;), using the modified prospective transition method, and therefore
has not restated the results of prior periods.&#160;&#160;The additional expense
recorded in 2006 as a result of this adoption is approximately $3
thousand.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Effects
of Recently Issued Accounting Standards</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">FAS 157
Evaluation</font></font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>On January 1, 2008, we adopted FASB
Statement No. 157, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Fair Value
Measurements </font>(&#8220;FAS No. 157&#8221;).&#160;&#160;This standard defines fair
value, establishes a methodology for measuring fair value and expands the
required disclosure for fair value measurements.&#160;&#160;FAS No. 157
emphasizes that fair value is a market-based measurement, not an entity-specific
measurement, and states that a fair value measurement should be determined based
on the assumptions that market participants would use in pricing the asset or
liability.&#160;&#160;This statement applies under other accounting
pronouncements that require or permit fair value measurements, the FASB having
previously concluded in those pronouncements that fair value is the relevant
measurement attribute.&#160;&#160;Accordingly, this statement does not require
any new fair value measurements.&#160;&#160;The standard applies prospectively
to new fair value measurements performed after the required effective dates,
which are as follows: (i) on January 1, 2008, the standard applied to our
measurements of the fair values of financial instruments and recurring fair
value measurements of non-financial assets and liabilities; and (ii) on January
1, 2009, the standard will apply to all remaining fair value measurements,
including non-recurring measurements of non-financial assets and liabilities
such as measurement of potential impairments of goodwill, other intangible
assets and other long-lived assets. It also will apply to fair value
measurements of non-financial assets acquired and liabilities assumed in
business combinations.&#160;&#160;We evaluated FAS No. 157 and determined that
the adoption of the provisions FAS No. 157 effective on January 1, 2008 and 2009
had no impact on our financial statements.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">FAS 159
Evaluation</font></font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>In February 2007, the FASB issued SFAS
No. 159, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">The Fair Value Option
for Financial Assets and Financial Liabilities</font> (&#8220;SFAS No.
159&#8221;).&#160;&#160;SFAS No. 159 permits entities to choose to measure certain
financial assets and liabilities at fair value, with the change in unrealized
gains and losses on items for which the fair value option has been elected
reported in earnings.&#160;&#160;We adopted SFAS No. 159 on January 1,
2008.&#160;&#160;We evaluated SFAS No. 159 and did not elect the fair value
accounting option for any of our eligible assets; therefore, the adoption of
SFAS 159 had no impact on our financial statements.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">FAS 141(R)
Evaluation</font></font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>On December 4, 2007, the FASB issued
Statement No. 141(R), <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Business
Combinations</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">&#160;</font>(&#8220;FAS
141(R)&#8221;).&#160;&#160;The new standard will significantly change the accounting
for and reporting of business combination transactions.&#160;&#160;FAS 141(R)
requires companies to recognize, with certain exception, 100 percent of the fair
value of the assets acquired, liabilities assumed and non-controlling interest
in acquisitions of less than a 100 percent controlling interest when the
acquisition constitutes a change in control; measure acquirer shares issued as
consideration for a business combination at fair value on the date of the
acquisition; recognize contingent consideration arrangements at their
acquisition date fair value, with subsequent change in fair value generally
reflected in earnings; recognition of reacquisition loss and gain contingencies
at their acquisition date fair value; expense as incurred, acquisition related
transaction costs.&#160;&#160;FAS 141(R) is effective for fiscal years beginning
after December 15, 2008 and early adoption is prohibited.&#160;&#160;We intend
to adopt the standard on January 1, 2009.&#160;&#160;We are currently evaluating
the impact, if any, that FAS 141(R) will have on our financial
statements.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">-F14-</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">OMEGA
HEALTHCARE INVESTORS, INC.</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED
FINANCIAL STATEMENTS - Continued</font> </font></div>
        </div>

      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Risks
and Uncertainties</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Our company is subject to certain risks
and uncertainties affecting the healthcare industry as a result of healthcare
legislation and growing regulation by federal, state and local governments.
Additionally, we are subject to risks and uncertainties as a result of changes
affecting operators of nursing home facilities due to the actions of
governmental agencies and insurers to limit the growth in cost of healthcare
services (see Note 7 &#8211; Concentration of Risk).</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Reclassifications</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Certain amounts in the prior year have
been reclassified to conform to the 2008 presentation and to reflect the results
of discontinued operations.&#160;&#160;Such reclassifications have no effect on
previously reported earnings or equity.&#160;&#160;See Note 19 &#8211; Discontinued
Operations for a discussion of discontinued operations.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTE
3 - PROPERTIES</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Leased
Property</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Our
leased real estate properties, represented by 238 long-term care facilities and
two rehabilitation hospitals at December 31, 2008, are leased under provisions
of single leases and master leases with initial terms typically ranging from 5
to 15 years, plus renewal options.&#160;&#160;Substantially all of the leases
and master leases provide for minimum annual rentals that are typically subject
to annual increases based upon the lesser of a fixed amount or increases derived
from changes in CPI.&#160;&#160;Under the terms of the leases, the lessee is
responsible for all maintenance, repairs, taxes and insurance on the leased
properties.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">A summary
of our investment in leased real estate properties is as follows:</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div>

      31,</font></div>

            <tr>
              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="76%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Land</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0.55pt"></font>92,746</font></td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0.4pt"></font>82,906</font></td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>

              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>

    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Below is
a summary of the significant lease transactions that occurred in
2008.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">2008
Acquisitions</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">On
December 31, 2008, we purchased two (2) SNFs from an unrelated third party for
$19.5 million and leased those facilities to an existing operator,
Formation.&#160;&#160;The facilities were added to Formation&#8217;s existing master
lease and will increase cash rent by $2.4 million annually starting in
2009.&#160;&#160;The $19.5 million was allocated to building and personal
property of $18.7 million and $0.8 million, respectively.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">-F15-</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">OMEGA
HEALTHCARE INVESTORS, INC.</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED
FINANCIAL STATEMENTS - Continued</font> </font></div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In
September 2008, we purchased four (4) SNFs, one (1) ALF and one (1) independent
living facility (&#8220;ILF&#8221;) for $40.0 million from subsidiaries of an existing
tenant, and leased those facilities back to the tenant.&#160;&#160;The
facilities were added to the tenant&#8217;s existing master lease and will increase
cash rent by $4.0 million annually.&#160;&#160;The $40.0 million acquisition
price was allocated $2.4 million to land, $35.4 million to building and $2.2
million to personal property.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In April
2008, we purchased seven (7) SNFs, one (1) ALF and one rehab hospital for $47.4
million from an unrelated third party and leased the facilities to an existing
tenant of ours.&#160;&#160;The facilities were added to the tenant&#8217;s existing
master lease and will increase cash rent by $4.7 million
annually.&#160;&#160;The $47.4 million acquisition price was allocated $6.6
million to land, $38.9 million to building and $1.9 million to personal
property.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In
January 2008, we purchased one (1) SNF for $5.2 million from an unrelated third
party and leased the facility to an existing tenant of ours.&#160;&#160;The
facility was added to the tenant&#8217;s existing master lease and increased cash rent
by $0.5 million annually.&#160;&#160;The $5.2 million acquisition price was
allocated $0.4 million to land, $4.5 million to building and $0.3 million to
personal property.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In
January 2008, we purchased from GE Capital a $39.0 million first mortgage loan
on seven (7) facilities operated by Haven due October 2012.&#160;&#160;Prior to
the acquisition of this first mortgage, we had a $22.8 million second mortgage
on these facilities.&#160;&#160;In July 2008, we acquired these properties from
Haven through a credit bid with the United States Bankruptcy
Court.&#160;&#160;These facilities were part of the Haven&#8217;s chapter 11
proceeding being jointly administered in the United States Bankruptcy Court for
the District of Connecticut, New Haven Division that began in November
2007.&#160;&#160;We consolidated the Haven entity which owned these facilities
into our financial statements in accordance with FIN 46R because we determined
that the Haven entity was a VIE and that we were the primary beneficiary, see
Note 1 &#8211; Organization and Basis of Presentation for additional
information.&#160;&#160;In 2007, the Haven facilities represented approximately
8% of our operating revenue.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">2007
Acquisitions</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">During
the third quarter of 2007, we completed a transaction with Litchfield Investment
Company, LLC and its affiliates (&#8220;Litchfield&#8221;) to purchase five (5) SNFs for a
total investment of $39.5 million.&#160;&#160;The facilities total 645 beds and
are located in Alabama (1), Georgia (2), Kentucky (1) and Tennessee
(1).&#160;&#160;We also provided a $2.5 million loan in the form of a
subordinated note as part of the transaction, which was repaid in full during
the fourth quarter 2007.&#160;&#160;Simultaneously with the close of the
purchase transaction, the facilities were combined into an Amended and Restated
Master Lease with Signature Holding II, LLC (formerly known as Home Quality
Management, Inc.)&#160;&#160;The Amended and Restated Master Lease was extended
until July 31, 2017.&#160;&#160;The investment allocated to land, building and
personal property is $6.3 million, $32.1 million and $1.1 million,
respectively.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">During
the third quarter of 2007, we continued our restructure of a five (5) facility
master lease with USA Healthcare whereby we have agreed to sell three (3)
facilities and reduce the overall annual rent on the master lease by $0.4
million.&#160;&#160;During the fourth quarter of 2007, two (2) of the facilities
were sold for approximately $2.8 million in cash proceeds and the overall annual
rent on the master lease is reduced by $0.4 million.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">2006
Acquisitions</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In the
third quarter of 2006, we completed two transactions: (i) on August 1, 2006, we
purchase a 100% interest in 30 SNFs and one (1) ILF from Litchfield; and (ii) on
September 1, 2006, we purchased a 100% interest in a facility located in
Pennsylvania, the combined total investment was $178.9 million.&#160;&#160;We
have finalized the purchase price allocation of the $178.9
million.&#160;&#160;The amount allocated to land, building and personal property
is $15.4 million, $154.4 million and $7.5 million, respectively, including $1.8
million in land and building classified as held for sale.&#160;&#160;We also
allocated $1.6 million to a below-market lease.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Assets
Sold or Held for Sale</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div>
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">
          <tr valign="top">
            <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 36pt">
              <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">At
      December 31, 2008, we had one SNF classified as held-for-sale with a net
      book value of approximately $0.2 million.&#160;&#160;In 2008, a $0.2
      million provision for impairment charge was recorded to reduce the
      carrying value of our held-for-sale facility to its estimated fair
      value.</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>
      </table>
    </div>

    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTE
4 &#8211; OWNED AND OPERATED ASSETS</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt"></font>At December 31, 2008, we own and are
operating two facilities with a total of 279 beds that were previously recovered
from a bankrupt operator/tenant.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Since November 2007, affiliates of
Haven, one of our operators/lessees/mortgagors, operated under Chapter 11
bankruptcy protection.&#160;&#160;Commencing in February 2008, the assets of the
Haven facilities were marketed for sale via an auction process to be conducted
through proceedings established by the bankruptcy court.&#160;&#160;The auction
process failed to produce a qualified buyer.&#160;&#160;As a result, and
pursuant to our rights as ordered by the bankruptcy court, Haven moved the
bankruptcy court to authorize us to credit bid certain of the indebtedness that
it owed to us in exchange for taking ownership of and transitioning certain of
its assets to a new entity in which we have a substantial ownership interest,
all of which was approved by the bankruptcy court on July 4,
2008.&#160;&#160;Effective as of July 7, 2008, we took ownership and/or
possession of 15 facilities previously operated by Haven and TC Healthcare, a
new entity and an interim operator in which we have a substantial economic
interest, began operating these facilities on our behalf through an independent
contractor.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">-F17-</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">OMEGA
HEALTHCARE INVESTORS, INC.</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED
FINANCIAL STATEMENTS - Continued</font> </font></div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>On August 6, 2008, we entered into a
Master Transaction Agreement (&#8220;MTA&#8221;) with affiliates of Formation whereby
Formation agreed (subject to certain closing conditions, including the receipt
of licensure) to lease 14 SNFs and one ALF facility under a master
lease.&#160;&#160;These facilities were formerly leased to Haven.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Effective September 1, 2008, we
completed the operational transfer, of 12 SNFs and one ALF to affiliates of
Formation, in accordance with the terms of the MTA.&#160;&#160;The 13 facilities
are located in Connecticut (5), Rhode Island (4), New Hampshire (3) and
Massachusetts (1).&#160;&#160;As part of the transaction, Genesis Healthcare
(&#8220;Genesis&#8221;) has entered into a long-term management agreement with Formation to
oversee the day-to-day operations of each of these facilities. The two remaining
facilities in Vermont, which are currently being operated by TC Healthcare, will
transfer to Formation/Genesis upon the appropriate regulatory approvals expected
sometime in the near future.&#160;&#160;Our financial statements include the
financial position and results of operations of TC Healthcare from July 7, 2008
to December 31, 2008.&#160;&#160;As of December 31, 2008, our gross investment
in land and buildings for the two properties operated by TC Healthcare was
approximately $14.4 million.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt"></font>Nursing home revenues, expenses, assets
and liabilities included in our consolidated financial statements that relate to
such owned and operated assets are set forth in the tables below.</font></div>

      thousands)</font></div>

              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>

            <tr>
              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="76%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Nursing
      home revenues <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">(1)

    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTE
5 - MORTGAGE NOTES RECEIVABLE</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Mortgage notes receivable relate to
fixed-rate mortgages on 15 long-term care facilities.&#160;&#160;The mortgage
notes are secured by first mortgage liens on the borrowers' underlying real
estate and personal property.&#160;&#160;The mortgage notes receivable relate to
facilities located in four states, operated by four independent healthcare
operating companies.&#160;&#160;We monitor compliance with mortgages and when
necessary have initiated collection, foreclosure and other proceedings with
respect to certain outstanding loans.&#160;&#160;As of December 31, 2008, we
have no foreclosed property and none of our mortgages were in foreclosure
proceedings.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">2008
and 2007 Mortgage Note Activity</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>In January 2008, we purchased from GE
Capital a $39.0 million mortgage loan due October 2012 on seven facilities then
operated by Haven.&#160;&#160;Prior to the acquisition of this mortgage, we had
a $22.8 million second mortgage on these facilities, resulting in a combined
$61.8 million mortgage on these facilities immediately following the purchase
from GE Capital.&#160;&#160;In conjunction with the above-noted mortgage and the
application of FIN 46R, we consolidated the financial statements and real estate
of the Haven entity that was the obligor under this mortgage loan into our
financial statements.&#160;&#160;On July 7, 2008, we took ownership and/or
possession of the Haven facilities and a new entity assumed operations of the
facilities.&#160;&#160;As a result of our taking ownership and/or possession of
the Haven facilities, effective July 7, 2008, the mortgage note was retired and
we were no longer required to consolidate the Haven entity.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
        </div>
        <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
          <div id="FTR">
            <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center" align="left"><font size="2" style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">-F18-</font></div>
          </div>

            <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            </div>
            <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
              <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">OMEGA
HEALTHCARE INVESTORS, INC.</font></div>
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED
FINANCIAL STATEMENTS - Continued</font> </font></div>

      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">&#160;</div>
      <div id="HDR">&#160;</div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>On April 18, 2008, and simultaneous
with the amendment and extension of the master lease with CommuniCare Health
Services (&#8220;CommuniCare&#8221;), we entered into a first mortgage loan with CommuniCare
in the amount of $74.9 million.&#160;&#160;This mortgage loan matures on April
30, 2018 and carries an interest rate of 11% per year.&#160;&#160;The $74.9
million mortgage included $4.9 million in funds placed in escrow for the
purchase of a facility that was pending environmental and other studies prior to
closure.&#160;&#160;In December 2008, CommuniCare notified us of their decision
not to purchase the additional facility and the escrow agent returned the
escrowed funds to us.&#160;&#160;As of December 31, 2008, the outstanding
mortgage note was $69.9 million.&#160;&#160;CommuniCare used the proceeds of the
mortgage loan to acquire seven (7) SNFs located in Maryland, totaling 965 beds
from several unrelated third parties.&#160;&#160;The mortgage loan is secured by
a lien on the seven (7) facilities.&#160;&#160;The mortgage properties are
cross-collateralized with the master lease agreement.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
outstanding principal amounts of mortgage notes receivable, net of allowances,
were as follows:</font></div>

    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">At
December 31, 2008, we had 9 notes receivable, with maturities ranging from on
demand to 2018.&#160;&#160;At December 31, 2007, we had 10 notes receivable,
with maturities ranging from on demand to 2016.&#160;&#160;At December 31, 2008
and 2007, we had total reserves of approximately $2.2 million on two
notes.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>For the year ended December 31, 2008
and 2007, apart from the normal scheduled monthly loan payments, we had the
following transactions that impacted our other investments:</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">2008
Transactions</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Haven
Properties Debtor-in-Possession Financing Agreement</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>In January 2008, Haven entered into a
debtors-in-possession financing (&#8220;DIP&#8221;) agreement with us and one other
financial institution (collectively, the &#8220;DIP Lenders&#8221;), in which our initial
participation was approximately $5.0 million of a $50 million total
commitment.&#160;&#160;The agreement was originally scheduled to mature in June
2008 and yield an interest rate of the greater of prime plus 3% or 9.5%
annually.&#160;&#160;On June 4, 2008, the DIP Lenders and Haven amended the DIP
agreement (the &#8220;Amended DIP&#8221;) which, among other things, extended the term to
allow Haven additional time to sell its assets.&#160;&#160;As collateral for the
Amended DIP, we received the right to use all facility accounts receivable
generated from the Omega facilities from June 4, 2008 to satisfy any of our
post-June 3, 2008 advances.&#160;&#160;As of December 31, 2008, we had collected
all outstanding balances on the DIP agreement and had $1.2 million net
outstanding related to the Amended DIP.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div>

          <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">OMEGA
HEALTHCARE INVESTORS, INC.</font></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED
