    <div><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Formation
Capital Note Origination</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>In September 2008, we entered into a
loan agreement with Formation pursuant to which we agreed to provide Formation
up to $23.0 million working capital in two years.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Alden
Management Note Payoff</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>In May 2008, we received approximately
$0.8 million in proceeds on a loan payoff.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Mark
Ide Limited Liability Company Note Payoff</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>In May 2008, we received approximately
$1.3 million in proceeds on a loan payoff.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Nexion
Health, Inc. Note Payoff</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>In February 2008, we received
approximately $0.1 million in proceeds on a loan payoff.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">2007
Transactions</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Debtor-in-Possession
Financing Agreement</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>In May 2007, we entered into a DIP
financing agreement with one of our operators, providing up to $6.0 million to
maintain its day-to-day operation while it was undergoing its workout
plan.&#160;&#160;The balance was paid off in August 2007.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Alden
Management Note Payoff</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>In August 2007, we received
approximately $4.0 million in proceeds on a loan payoff.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTE
7 - CONCENTRATION OF RISK</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>As of December 31, 2008, our portfolio
of domestic investments consisted of 256 healthcare facilities, located in 28
states and operated by 25 third-party operators.&#160;&#160;Our gross investment
in these facilities, net of impairments and before reserve for uncollectible
loans, totaled approximately $1.5 billion at December 31, 2008, with
approximately 99% of our real estate investments related to long-term care
facilities.&#160;&#160;This portfolio is made up of 227 SNFs, seven ALFs, two
rehabilitation hospitals, two ILFs, fixed rate mortgages on 15 SNFS, two SNFS
that are owned and operated and one SNF is currently held for
sale.&#160;&#160;At December 31, 2008, we also held miscellaneous investments of
approximately $29.9 million, consisting primarily of secured loans to
third-party operators of our facilities.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>At December 31, 2008, approximately 24%
of our real estate investments were operated by two public companies: Sun
Healthcare Group, Inc (&#8220;Sun&#8221;) (14%) and Advocat (10%).&#160;&#160;Our largest
private company operators (by investment) were CommuniCare (22%), Signature
Holding II, LLC (10%).&#160;&#160;No other operator represents more than 9% of
our investments.&#160;&#160;The three states in which we had our highest
concentration of investments were Ohio (23%), Florida (12%) and Pennsylvania
(10%) at December 31, 2008.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>For the year ended December 31, 2008,
our revenues from operations totaled $193.8 million, of which approximately
$31.7 million were from Sun (16%), $31.6 million from CommuniCare (16%) and
$20.5 million from Advocat (11%).&#160;&#160;No other operator generated more
than 9% of our revenues from operations for the year ended December 31,
2008.&#160;&#160;In addition, our owned and operated assets generated $24.2
million (12%) of revenue in 2008.&#160;&#160;Thirteen of these facilities were
transitioned/leased to a new operator/tenant effective September 1,
2008.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Sun and Advocat are subject to the
reporting requirements of the SEC and are required to file with the SEC annual
reports containing audited financial information and quarterly reports
containing unaudited interim financial information.&#160;&#160;Sun&#8217;s and
Advocat&#8217;s filings with the SEC can be found at the SEC&#8217;s website at
www.sec.gov.&#160;&#160;We are providing this data for information purposes
only, and you are encouraged to obtain Sun&#8217;s and Advocat&#8217;s publicly available
filings from the SEC.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">-F20-</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">OMEGA
HEALTHCARE INVESTORS, INC.</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED
FINANCIAL STATEMENTS - Continued</font> </font></div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTE
8 - LEASE AND MORTGAGE DEPOSITS</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>We obtain liquidity deposits and
letters of credit from most operators pursuant to our lease and mortgage
contracts with the operators.&#160;&#160;These generally represent the rental
and mortgage interest for periods ranging from three to six months with respect
to certain of its investments.&#160;&#160;At December 31, 2008, we held $6.3
million in such liquidity deposits and $29.6 million in letters of
credit.&#160;&#160;The liquidity deposits may be applied in the event of lease
and loan defaults, subject to applicable limitations under bankruptcy law with
respect to operators filing under Chapter 11 of the United States Bankruptcy
Code.&#160;&#160;Liquidity deposits are recorded as restricted cash on our
consolidated balance sheet.&#160;&#160;Additional security for rental and
mortgage interest revenue from operators is provided by covenants regarding
minimum working capital and net worth, liens on accounts receivable and other
operating assets of the operators, provisions for cross default, provisions for
cross-collateralization and by corporate/personal guarantees.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTE
9 - BORROWING ARRANGEMENTS</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Secured
Borrowings</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>At December 31, 2008, we had $63.5
million outstanding under our $255.0 million revolving senior secured credit
facility (the &#8220;Credit Facility&#8221;) and no letters of credit outstanding, leaving
availability of $191.5 million as of December 31, 2008.&#160;&#160;The $63.5
million of outstanding borrowings had a blended interest rate of 2.0% at
December 31, 2008.&#160;&#160;The Credit Facility matures in March
2010.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>At December 31, 2007, we had $48.0
million outstanding under the Credit Facility and $2.1 million of letters of
credit outstanding.&#160;&#160;The $48.0 million of outstanding borrowings had a
blended interest rate of 6.15% at December 31, 2007.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>For the years ended December 31, 2008
and 2007, the weighted average interest rates were 3.89% and 6.70%,
respectively.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>The Credit Agreement (the &#8220;Credit
Agreement&#8221;) that governs our Credit Facility, allowed us to increase our
available borrowing base under the Credit Agreement from $200.0 million up to an
aggregate of $300.0 million, subject to certain conditions.&#160;&#160;Effective
February 22, 2007, we exercised our right to increase the available revolving
commitment under the Credit Agreement from $200.0 million to $255.0 million and
we consented to the addition of 18 of our properties to the borrowing base
assets under the Credit Agreement.&#160;&#160;In 2007, we paid approximately
$0.7 million in fees and expenses associated with increasing the available
revolving commitments.&#160;&#160;At December 31, 2008, we had real estate
assets with a gross book value of $271.5 million pledged as collateral for the
Credit Facility.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Our long-term borrowings require us to
meet certain property level financial covenants and corporate financial
covenants, including prescribed leverage, fixed charge coverage, minimum net
worth, limitations on additional indebtedness and limitations on dividend
payouts.&#160;&#160;As of December 31, 2008, we were in compliance with all
property level and corporate financial covenants.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>The Credit Agreement has certain
financial covenants that limit the distribution of dividends paid during a
fiscal quarter to no more than 95% of our aggregate cumulative Funds From
Operations (&#8220;FFO&#8221;) as defined in the Credit Agreement unless a greater
distribution is required to maintain REIT status.&#160;&#160;The Credit
Agreement defines FFO as net income (or loss) plus depreciation and amortization
and shall be adjusted for charges related to: (i) restructuring our debt; (ii)
redemption of preferred stock; (iii) litigation charges up to $5.0 million; (iv)
non-cash charges for accounts and notes receivable up to $5.0 million; (v)
non-cash compensation related expenses; (vi) non-cash impairment charges; and
(vii) tax liabilities in an amount not to exceed $8.0 million.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Unsecured
Borrowings</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Other
Long-Term Borrowings</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>In January 2008, we purchased from GE
Capital a $39.0 million mortgage loan due October 2012 on seven facilities then
operated by Haven.&#160;&#160;Prior to the acquisition of this mortgage, we had
a $22.8 million second mortgage on these facilities, resulting in a combined
$61.8 million mortgage on these facilities immediately following the purchase
from GE Capital.&#160;&#160;In conjunction with the above-noted mortgage and
purchase option and the application of FIN 46R, we consolidated the financial
statements and real estate of the Haven entity that was the obligor under this
mortgage loan into our financial statements.&#160;&#160;On July 7, 2008, we took
ownership and/or possession of the Haven facilities and TC Healthcare assumed
operations of the facilities.&#160;&#160;As a result of our taking ownership
and/or possession of the Haven facilities, effective July 7, 2008, the mortgage
note was retired and we were no longer required to consolidate the Haven entity
pursuant to FIN 46R.&#160;&#160;See Note 1 &#8211; Organization and Basis of
Presentation for additional discussion regarding the impact of the consolidation
of the Haven entity on our financial statements.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">

HEALTHCARE INVESTORS, INC.</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED

              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="88%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">2013</font></div>

                    <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
                    <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0.1pt"></font>40,995</font></td>
                    <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
                    <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
                    <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
                    <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0.1pt"></font>41,039</font></td>
                    <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
                  </tr>
                  <tr>
                    <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="52%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px">
                      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; TEXT-INDENT: -36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6pt"></font>Totals</font></div>
                    </td>
                    <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
                    <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">$</font></td>
                    <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">548,197</font></td>
                    <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
                    <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
                    <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">$</font></td>
                    <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">465,510</font></td>
                    <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
                    <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
                    <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">$</font></td>
                    <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">573,709</font></td>
                    <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
                    <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
                    <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">$</font></td>
                    <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">570,168</font></td>
                    <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
                  </tr>
              </table>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Fair value estimates are subjective in
nature and are dependent on a number of important assumptions, including
estimates of future cash flows, risks, discount rates and relevant comparable
market information associated with each financial instrument (see Note 2 &#8211;
Summary of Significant Accounting Policies).&#160;&#160;The use of different
market assumptions and estimation methodologies may have a material effect on
the reported estimated fair value amounts.&#160;&#160;Accordingly, the estimates
presented above are not necessarily indicative of the amounts we would realize
in a current market exchange.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>The following methods and assumptions
were used in estimating fair value disclosures for financial
instruments.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div>
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">
          <tr valign="top">
            <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 54pt">
              <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Cash
      and cash equivalents:&#160;&#160;The carrying amount of cash and cash
      equivalents reported in the balance sheet approximates fair value because
      of the short maturity of these instruments (i.e., less than 90
      days).</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>
      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div>
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">
          <tr valign="top">
            <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 54pt">
              <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Mortgage
      notes receivable:&#160;&#160;The fair values of the mortgage notes
      receivables are estimated using a discounted cash flow analysis, using
      interest rates being offered for similar loans to borrowers with similar
      credit ratings.</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>
      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div>
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">
          <tr valign="top">
            <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 54pt">
              <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Other
      investments:&#160;&#160;Other investments are primarily comprised of: (i)
      notes receivable; (ii) a redeemable non-convertible preferred security;
      and (iii) a subordinated debt instrument of a publicly traded company in
      2006 and paid off in 2007.&#160;&#160;The fair values of notes receivable
      are estimated using a discounted cash flow analysis, using interest rates
      being offered for similar loans to borrowers with similar credit
      ratings.&#160;&#160;The fair value of the marketable securities are
      estimated using discounted cash flow and volatility assumptions or, if
      available, a quoted market value.</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>
      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div>
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">
          <tr valign="top">
            <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 54pt">
              <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Revolving
      lines of credit:&#160;&#160;The fair value of our borrowings under
      variable rate agreements are estimated using an expected present value
      technique based on expected cash flows discounted using the current
      credit-adjusted risk-free rate.</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>
      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div>
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">
          <tr valign="top">
            <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 54pt">
              <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Senior
      notes and other long-term borrowings:&#160;&#160;The fair value of our
      borrowings under fixed rate agreements are estimated based on open market
      trading activity provided by a third
party.</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>
      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">-F23-</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">OMEGA
HEALTHCARE INVESTORS, INC.</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED
FINANCIAL STATEMENTS - Continued</font> </font></div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTE
11 &#8211; TAXES</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>We were organized, have operated, and
intend to continue to operate in a manner that enables us to qualify for
taxation as a REIT under Sections 856 through 860 of the Internal Revenue
Code.&#160;&#160;On a quarterly and annual basis we perform several analyses to
test our compliance within the REIT taxation rules.&#160;&#160;In order to
qualify as a REIT, we are required to: (i) distribute dividends (other than
capital gain dividends) to our stockholders in an amount at least equal to (A)
the sum of (a) 90% of our "REIT taxable income" (computed without regard to the
dividends paid deduction and our net capital gain), and (b) 90% of the net
income (after tax), if any, from foreclosure property, minus (B) the sum of
certain items of non-cash income on an annual basis, (ii) ensure that at least
75% and 95%, respectively of our gross income is generated from qualifying
sources that are described in the REIT tax law, (iii) ensure that at least 75%
of our assets consist of qualifying assets, such as real property, mortgages,
and other qualifying assets described in the REIT tax law, (iv) ensure that we
do not own greater than 10% of the voting or value of any one security, (v)
ensure that we don&#8217;t own either debt or equity securities of another company
that are in excess of 5% of our total assets and (vi) ensure that no more that
20% of our assets are invested in one or more taxable REIT subsidiaries. In
addition to the income and asset tests, the REIT rules require that no less than
100 shareholders own shares or an interest in the REIT and that five or fewer
individuals do not own (directly or indirectly) more than 50% of the shares or
proportionate interest in the REIT.&#160;&#160;If we fail to qualify as a REIT
in any tax year, we will be subject to federal income tax on our taxable income
at regular corporate rates and may not be able to qualify as a REIT for the four
subsequent years.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>We are also subject to federal taxation
of 100% of the derived net income if we sell or dispose of property, other than
foreclosure property, that we held primarily for sale to customers in the
ordinary course of a trade or business.&#160;&#160;We believe that we do not
hold assets for sale to customers in the ordinary course of business and that
none of the assets currently held for sale or that have been sold would be
considered a prohibited transaction within the REIT taxation rules.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>So long as we qualify as a REIT we
generally will not be subject to Federal income taxes on the REIT taxable income
that we distribute to stockholders, subject to certain exceptions.&#160;&#160;In
2008, we paid preferred and common dividend payments of $98.1 million which
satisfies the 2008 REIT requirements relating to the distribution of our REIT
Taxable Income.&#160;&#160;&#160;On a quarterly and annual basis we tested our
compliance within the REIT taxation rules described above to ensure that we were
in compliance with the rules.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>In July 2008, we assumed operating
responsibilities for the 15 Haven facilities due to the bankruptcy of one of our
operators/tenants.&#160;&#160;In September 2008, we entered into an agreement to
lease these facilities to a new operator/tenant.&#160;&#160;Effective September
1, 2008, the new operator/tenant assumed operating responsibility for 13 of the
15 facilities, and, as a result, we retained operating responsibility for two
properties as of December 31, 2008.&#160;&#160;We are in the process of
addressing state regulatory requirements necessary to transfer the final two
properties to the new operator/tenant.&#160;&#160;We intend to make an election
on our 2008 federal income tax return to treat the Haven facilities as
foreclosure properties.&#160;&#160;Because we acquired possession in connection
with a foreclosure, the Haven facilities are eligible to be treated as
foreclosure property until the end of 2011.&#160;&#160;Although the Secretary of
Treasury may extend the foreclosure property period until the end of 2014, there
can be no assurance that we will receive such an extension.&#160;&#160;So long
as the Haven facilities qualify as foreclosure property, our gross income from
the properties will be qualifying income for the 75% and 95% gross income tests,
but we will generally be subject to corporate income tax at the highest rate on
the net income from the properties.&#160;&#160;If one or more of the Haven
facilities were to inadvertently fail to qualify as foreclosure property, we
would likely recognize nonqualifying income from such property for purposes of
the 75% and 95% gross income tests, which could cause us to fail to qualify as a
REIT.&#160;&#160;In addition, any gain from a sale of such property could be
subject to the 100% prohibited transactions tax.&#160;&#160;Although we intend
to sell or lease the remaining Haven facilities to one or more unrelated third
parties prior to the end of 2011, no assurance can be provided that we will
accomplish that objective.&#160;&#160;After the year 2000, the definition of
foreclosure property was amended to include any &#8220;qualified health care
property,&#8221; as defined in Code Section 856(e)(6) acquired by us as the result of
the termination or expiration of a lease of such property.&#160;&#160;We have
operated qualified healthcare facilities acquired in this manner for up to two
years (or longer if an extension was granted).&#160;&#160;However, we do not
currently own any property with respect to which we have made foreclosure
property elections.&#160;&#160;Properties that we had taken back in a
foreclosure or bankruptcy and operated for our own account were treated as
foreclosure properties for income tax purposes, pursuant to Internal Revenue
Code Section 856(e).&#160;&#160;Gross income from foreclosure properties was
classified as &#8220;good income&#8221; for purposes of the annual REIT income tests upon
making the election on the tax return.&#160;&#160;Once made, the income was
classified as &#8220;good&#8221; for a period of three years, or until the properties were
no longer operated for our own account.&#160;&#160;In all cases of foreclosure
property, we utilized an independent contractor to conduct day-to-day operations
to maintain REIT status.&#160;&#160;In certain cases we operated these
facilities through a taxable REIT subsidiary.&#160;&#160;For those properties
operated through the taxable REIT subsidiary, we utilized an eligible
independent contractor to conduct day-to-day operations to maintain REIT
status.&#160;&#160;As a result of the foregoing, we do not believe that our
participation in the operation of nursing homes increased the risk that we would
fail to qualify as a REIT.&#160;&#160;Through our 2008 taxable year, we had not
paid any tax on our foreclosure property because those properties had been
producing losses.&#160;&#160;We cannot predict whether, in the future, our
income from foreclosure property will be significant and/or whether we could be
required to pay a significant amount of tax on that income.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">-F24-</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">OMEGA
HEALTHCARE INVESTORS, INC.</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED
FINANCIAL STATEMENTS - Continued</font> </font></div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Subject to the limitation described
above under the REIT asset test rules, we are permitted to own up to 100% of the
stock of one or more TRSs.&#160;&#160;Currently, we have one TRS that is taxable
as a corporation and that pays federal, state and local income tax on its net
income at the applicable corporate rates.&#160;&#160;The TRS had a net operating
loss carry-forward as of December 31, 2008 of $1.1 million.&#160;&#160;The loss
carry-forward was fully reserved with a valuation allowance due to uncertainties
regarding realization.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><a name="FIS_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS">NOTE 12 - RETIREMENT
ARRANGEMENTS</a></font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Our company has a 401(k) Profit Sharing
Plan covering all eligible employees.&#160;&#160;Under this plan, employees are
eligible to make contributions, and we, at our discretion, may match
contributions and make a profit sharing contribution.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>We have a Deferred Compensation Plan
which is an unfunded plan under which we can award units that result in
participation in the dividends and future growth in the value of our common
stock.&#160;&#160;There are no outstanding units as of December 31,
2008.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Amounts charged to operations with
respect to these retirement arrangements totaled approximately $151,500, $77,600
and $62,700 in 2008, 2007 and 2006, respectively.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTE
13 &#8211; STOCKHOLDERS&#8217; EQUITY</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Stockholders&#8217;
Equity</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Purchase
of 400,000 shares of Series D Preferred Stock</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>On October 16, 2008, we purchased
400,000 shares of our Series D Preferred Stock (NYSE:OHI PrD) at a price of
$18.90 per share.&#160;&#160;The liquidation preference for the Series D
Preferred Stock (&#8220;Series D&#8221;) is $25.00 per share.&#160;&#160;Under FASB-EITF
Issue D-42, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">The Effect on the
Calculation of Earnings per Share for the Redemption or Induced Conversion of
Preferred Stock</font>, the purchase of the Series D Preferred Stock shares
resulted in a fourth quarter 2008 gain of approximately $2.1 million, net of a
non-cash charge $0.3 million reflecting the write-off of the pro-rata portion of
the original issuance costs of the Series D Preferred Stock.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">6.0
Million Share Common Stock Offering</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>On September 19, 2008, we closed an
underwritten public offering of 6.0 million shares our common stock at $16.37
per share.&#160;&#160;The net proceeds, after deducting underwriting discounts
and offering expenses, were approximately $96.9 million.&#160;&#160;The net
proceeds were used to repay indebtedness under our senior credit facility and
for working capital and general corporate purposes.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">5.9
Million Common Stock Offering</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>On May 6, 2008, we have issued 5.9
million shares of our common stock at $16.93 per share in a registered direct
placement to a number of institutional investors.&#160;&#160;The net proceeds
from the offering were approximately $98.8 million, after deducting the
placement agent&#8217;s fee and other estimated offering expense.&#160;&#160;The net
proceeds were used to repay indebtedness under our senior credit
facility.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Dividend
Reinvestment and Common Stock Purchase Plan</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>We have a Dividend Reinvestment and
Common Stock Purchase Plan (the &#8220;DRSPP&#8221;) that allows for the reinvestment of
dividends and the optional purchase of our common stock.&#160;&#160;For the
twelve-month period ended December 31, 2008, we issued 2,067,809 shares of
common stock for approximately $34.1 million in net proceeds.&#160;&#160;For the
twelve- month period ended December 31, 2007, we issued 1,189,779 shares of
common stock for approximately $18.9 million in net proceeds.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">On
October 29, 2008, we announced the immediate suspension of the optional cash
purchase component of our DRSPP until further notice.&#160;&#160;Dividend
reinvestment and all other features of the DRSPP will continue as set forth in
the DRSPP, including sales, transfers and certificate issuances of stock held in
participant accounts.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Stockholders participating in the DRSPP
who have elected to reinvest dividends will continue to have cash dividends
reinvested in accordance with the DRSPP.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          </div>
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">-F25-</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">OMEGA
HEALTHCARE INVESTORS, INC.</font></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED
FINANCIAL STATEMENTS - Continued</font> </font></div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">7.130 Million Common Stock
Offering</font></font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>On April 3, 2007, we completed an
underwritten public offering of 7,130,000 shares our common stock at $16.75 per
share, less underwriting discounts. The sale included 930,000 shares sold in
connection with the exercise of an over-allotment option granted to the
underwriters.&#160;&#160;We received approximately $112.9 million in net
proceeds from the sale of the shares, after deducting underwriting discounts and
offering expenses.&#160;&#160;The net proceeds were used to repay indebtedness
under our Credit Facility.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTE
14 &#8211;STOCK-BASED COMPENSATION</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 45.8pt"></font>We offer stock-based compensation to
our employees that include stock options, restricted stock awards and
performance share awards.&#160;&#160;Under the terms of our 2000 Stock Incentive
Plan (the &#8220;2000 Plan&#8221;) and the 2004 Stock Incentive Plan (the &#8220;2004 Plan&#8221;), we
reserved 3,500,000 shares and 3,000,000 shares of common stock,
respectively.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Stock
Options</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 45.8pt"></font>The 2000 and 2004 Plan allows for the
issuance of stock options to employees, directors and consultants at exercise
price equal to the Company&#8217;s common stock price on the date of
grant.&#160;&#160;The 2000 Plan and 2004 Plan do not allow for a reduction in
the exercise price after the date of grant, nor does it allow for an option to
be cancelled in exchange for an option with a lower exercise price per
share.&#160;&#160;At December 31, 2008, there were 25,664 options outstanding
under the 2000 Plan with a weighted average exercise price of $12.88 per
share.&#160;&#160;We have not issued stock option to employees, directors or
consultants since 2004.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 45.8pt"></font>Cash received from the exercise under
all stock-based payment arrangements for the year ended 2008, 2007 and 2006 was
$0.1 million, $58 thousand and $0.9 million, respectively.&#160;&#160;Cash used
to settle equity instruments granted under stock-based payment arrangements for
the year ended 2008, 2007 and 2006, was $2.7 million, $0.8 million and $0.7
million, respectively.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Restricted
Stock</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 45.8pt"></font>Restricted stock awards are
independent of stock option grants and are subject to forfeiture if the holder&#8217;s
service to us terminates prior to vesting.&#160;&#160;Prior to vesting,
ownership of the shares cannot be transferred.&#160;&#160;The restricted stock
has the same dividend and voting rights as the common stock.&#160;&#160;We
expense the cost of these awards ratably over their vesting period.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 45.8pt"></font>In 2004, we granted 317,500 shares of
restricted stock to four executive officers under the 2004 Plan.&#160;&#160;The
shares vest thirty-three and one-third percent (33 1/3%) on each of January 1,
2005, January 1, 2006 and January 1, 2007 so long as the executive officer
remains employed on the vesting date.&#160;&#160;As of December 31, 2007, there
were no shares of unvested restricted stock outstanding.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 45.8pt"></font>In May 2007, we granted 286,908
shares of restricted stock to five executive officers under the 2004
Plan.&#160;&#160;The restricted stock award vests one-seventh on December 31,
2007 and two-sevenths on December 31, 2008, December 31, 2009, and December 31,
2010, respectively, subject to continued employment on the vesting date (as
defined in the agreements filed with the SEC on May 8, 2007).&#160;&#160;As of
December 31, 2008, there were 163,947 shares of unvested restricted stock
outstanding.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 45.8pt"></font>In addition, in January of each year
we grant restricted stock to directors as part of the annual
retainer.&#160;&#160;These shares vest ratably over a three year
period.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div>

    2006</font></div>
                  </td>
                  <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>

          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(1)&#160;&#160;Total
compensation cost to be recognized on the awards based on grant date fair
value.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Performance
Restricted Stock Units</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 45.8pt"></font>Performance Restricted Stock Units
(&#8220;PRSU&#8221;) are subject to forfeiture if the employee terminates service prior to
vesting.&#160;&#160;Prior to vesting, ownership of the shares cannot be
transferred.&#160;&#160;The dividends on the PRSUs accumulate and if vested are
paid.&#160;&#160;We expense the cost of these awards ratably over their service
period.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 45pt"></font>In September 2004, we issued 317,500
PRSU to four executive officers under the 2004 Plan.&#160;&#160;The PRSU fully
vest into shares of common stock if our company attains $0.30 per share of
adjusted funds from operations (&#8220;AFFO&#8221;) (as defined in the applicable restricted
stock unit agreements) for two (2) consecutive quarters.&#160;&#160;During the
third quarter of 2006, we achieved the vesting target as defined in the 2004
Plan, and recognized $3.3 million compensation expense associated with the
vesting of the performance shares.&#160;&#160;Pursuant to the terms of the
performance restricted stock unit agreements, each of the executive officers did
not receive the vested shares attributable to the performance restricted stock
units until January 1, 2008.&#160;&#160;As of December 31, 2007, we had 317,500
shares of PRSU vested and outstanding.&#160;&#160;We used the fair value on the
grant date to determine the compensation cost.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 45.8pt"></font>In May 2007, we awarded in two types
of PRSU (annual and cliff vesting awards) to our five executives totaling
247,992 shares.&#160;&#160;One half of the PRSU awards vest annually in equal
increments on December 31, 2008, December 31, 2009, and December 31, 2010,
respectively.&#160;&#160;The other half of the PRSU awards cliff vest on
December 31, 2010.&#160;&#160;Vesting on both types of awards requires
achievement of total shareholder return as defined in the agreements filed with
the SEC on May 8, 2007.&#160;&#160;All vested shares will be delivered to the
executive on January 2, 2011, provided that the executive is employed, or will
be delivered on the date of cessation of service as an employee if the employee
was terminated without cause or the employee terminated employment with
cause.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 45.8pt"></font>We used a Monte Carlo model to
estimate the fair value and derived service periods for PRSUs granted to the
executives in May 2007.&#160;&#160;The following are some of the significant
assumptions used in estimating the value of the awards:</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div>
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
          <tr>
            <td align="left" valign="top" width="40%">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Closing
      stock price on date of grant</font></div>
            </td>
            <td align="left" valign="top" width="14%">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">$17.06</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>
          <tr>
            <td align="left" valign="top" width="40%">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">20-day-average
      stock price</font></div>
            </td>
            <td align="left" valign="top" width="14%">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">$17.27</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

            <td align="left" valign="top" width="40%">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Risk-free
      interest rate at time of grant</font></div>
            </td>
            <td align="left" valign="top" width="14%">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">4.6%
      to 5.1%</font></div>

              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Expected

      to 29.4%</font></div>

                <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">$</font></td>
                <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">7.28</font></td>

          </table>
        </div>

    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTE
15 - DIVIDENDS</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Common
Dividends</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>On January 15, 2009, the Board of
Directors declared a common stock dividend of $0.30 per share that was paid on
February 17, 2009 to common stockholders of record on January 30,
2009.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>On October 16, 2008, the Board of
Directors declared a common stock dividend of $0.30 per share.&#160;&#160;The
common dividend was paid November 17, 2008 to common stockholders of record on
October 31, 2008.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>On July 16, 2008, the Board of
Directors declared a common stock dividend of $0.30 per share.&#160;&#160;The
common dividend was paid August 15, 2008 to common stockholders of record on
July 31, 2008.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>On April 16, 2008, the Board of
Directors declared a common stock dividend of $0.30 per share, an increase of
$0.01 per common share compared to the prior quarter.&#160;&#160;The common
dividend was paid May 15, 2008 to common stockholders of record on April 30,
2008.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>On January 17, 2008, the Board of
Directors declared a common stock dividend of $0.29 per share, an increase of
$0.01 per common share compared to the prior quarter.&#160;&#160;The common
dividend was paid February 15, 2008 to common stockholders of record on January
31, 2008.</font></div>

D Preferred Dividends</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>On January 15, 2009, the Board of
Directors declared regular quarterly dividends of approximately $0.52344 per
preferred share on its 8.375% Series D cumulative redeemable preferred stock
(the &#8220;Series D Preferred Stock&#8221;), that were paid February 17, 2009 to preferred
stockholders of record on January 30, 2009.&#160;&#160;The liquidation
preference for our Series D Preferred Stock is $25.00 per
share.&#160;&#160;Regular quarterly preferred dividends for the Series D
Preferred Stock represent dividends for the period November 1, 2008 through
January 31, 2009.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>On October 16, 2008, the Board of
Directors declared regular quarterly dividends of approximately $0.52344 per
preferred share on the Series D preferred stock that were paid November 17, 2008
to preferred stockholders of record on October 31, 2008.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>On July 16, 2008, the Board of

preferred share on the Series D Preferred Stock that were paid August 15, 2008
to preferred stockholders of record on July 31, 2008.</font></div>

              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>

              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="64%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px">

      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>For additional information regarding
dividends, see Note 9 &#8211; Borrowing Arrangements and Note 11 &#8211; Taxes.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTE
16 - LITIGATION</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>In 1999, we filed suit against a former
tenant seeking damages based on claims of breach of contract.&#160;&#160;The
defendants denied the allegations made in the lawsuit.&#160;&#160;In June 2008,
we were awarded damages in a jury trial.&#160;&#160;The case was then settled
prior to appeal.&#160;&#160;In settlement of our claim against the defendants,
we agreed in January 2009 to accept a lump sum cash payment of $6.8
million.&#160;&#160;The cash proceeds were offset by related expenses incurred
of $2.3 million, resulting in a net gain of $4.5 million paid in January
2009.&#160;&#160;This gain will be recorded during the first quarter of
2009.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font size="2" style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">-F29-</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">OMEGA
HEALTHCARE INVESTORS, INC.</font></div>
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED
FINANCIAL STATEMENTS - Continued</font> </font></div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In 2005,
we accrued $1.1 million to settle a dispute relating to capital improvement
requirements associated with a lease that expired June 30,
2005.&#160;&#160;Although no formal complaint for damages was filed against us,
in February 2006, we agreed to settle this dispute for approximately $1.0
million.&#160;&#160;In addition, we and several of our wholly-owned subsidiaries
were named as defendants in professional liability claims related to our owned
and operated facilities prior to 2005.&#160;&#160;Other third-party managers
responsible for the day-to-day operations of these facilities have also been
named as defendants in these claims.&#160;&#160;In these suits, patients of
certain previously owned and operated facilities have alleged significant
damages, including punitive damages against the defendants.&#160;&#160;While any
legal proceeding or claim has an element of uncertainty, management believes
that the outcome of each lawsuit, claim or legal proceeding that is pending or
threatened, or all of them combined, will not have a material adverse effect on
our consolidated financial position or results of operations.&#160; All of these
suits have been settled. </font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOTE

results of operations for the years ended December 31, 2008 and
2007.</font></div>
